title: Part 3: Continuous-Time Diffusion Models: SDE Formulations and Variational Objectives
summary: We extend diffusion models from discrete timesteps to a continuous-time framework. Starting from forward and reverse SDEs, we derive how noise schedules map to drift and diffusion coefficients, use Girsanov’s theorem to obtain a continuous-time ELBO, and show its connection to denoising score matching and Fisher information. We then explore the duality between stochastic SDE sampling and deterministic probability flow ODEs, and introduce Predictor–Corrector samplers. Finally, a toy 2D Gaussian example illustrates forward and reverse diffusion in practice.
